channel.title: GAIA Documentation on
channel.description: Recent content in GAIA Documentation on

item.description: The so called conventional approach is a well established and widely used metric to estimate the energy consumption. It follows an average allocation methodology, more specifically network electricity is allocated using an average energy per data volume metric $kWh/GB$.

item.title: Adaptive Streaming
item.description: Overview Adaptive Streaming is a method for improving streaming over HTTP networks. Adaptive streaming starts at the Encoding stage. For adaptive streaming to work, different video files with different bitrates are created.

item.title: Bitrate
item.description: The term bitrate refers to how quickly data travels across a network and is often used to describe an Internet connection’s speed.

item.title: Content Delivery Network
item.description: Content delivery networks (CDN) serve a specific region by storing copies of an original video closer to the consuming devices which reduces network congestion and improve the transmission times.

item.title: Data Centres
item.description: Process Component The process component of data centres contains the cloud storage, encoding services and Content Delivery Network (CDN).

item.title: Encoding
item.description: Encoding is the process of converting uncompressed videos into a format that can be stored and used on many devices.

item.title: Energy Consumption
item.description: This section is related to the energy consumption of computational devices. Approaches of Measuring the Energy Consumption Conventional Approach

item.title: Multimedia Presentation Description
item.description: Multimedia Presentation Description (MPD) is used by a DASH client to learn about metadata regarding available content on a server.

item.title: Streaming
item.description: Streaming is the process of transmitting video segments to client devices. For this, a video is first split into smaller clips so it is not necessary to wait for the entire video to be downloaded before watching it.

item.title: Transmission Network Energy
item.description: Transmission network energy intensity is used to relate the network energy that was consumed to a metric. Transmission network energy intensity estimates are usually derived from academic literature that evaluates the energy consumption of a transmission network and the volume of data that was transmitted through the network.
